App Frameworks.question: Accessibility
App Frameworks.answer: Make your apps accessible to everyone who uses Apple devices.

App Frameworks.question: App Clips
App Frameworks.answer: Create an app clip to make some of your app’s functionality available to users who don’t have the full app installed.

App Frameworks.question: AppKit
App Frameworks.answer: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.

App Frameworks.question: Bundle Resources
App Frameworks.answer: Resources located in an app, framework, or plugin bundle.

App Frameworks.question: Foundation
App Frameworks.answer: Access essential data types, collections, and operating-system services to define the base layer of functionality for your app.

App Frameworks.question: Mac Catalyst
App Frameworks.answer: Create a version of your iPad app that users can run on a Mac device.

App Frameworks.question: Swift
App Frameworks.answer: Build apps using a powerful open language.

App Frameworks.question: SwiftUI
App Frameworks.answer: Declare the user interface and behavior for your app on every platform.

App Frameworks.question: TVML
App Frameworks.answer: Use Apple TV Markup Language to create individual pages inside of a client-server app.

App Frameworks.question: TVMLKit JS
App Frameworks.answer: Create tvOS client-server apps using web technologies to stream media and respond to events.

App Frameworks.question: TVMLKit
App Frameworks.answer: Create client-server apps by incorporating JavaScript and TVML files in your binary app.

App Frameworks.question: TVUIKit
App Frameworks.answer: Show common user interface elements from Apple TV in your native app.

App Frameworks.question: UIKit
App Frameworks.answer: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS or tvOS app.

App Frameworks.question: WatchKit
App Frameworks.answer: Build apps that leverage watchOS features like background tasks, extended runtime sessions, and access to the Digital Crown.

App Services.question: Accounts
App Services.answer: Help users access and manage their external accounts from within your app, without requiring them to enter login credentials.

App Services.question: Address Book
App Services.answer: Access the centralized database for storing users’ contacts.

App Services.question: Address Book UI
App Services.answer: Access users’ contacts and display them in a graphical interface.

App Services.question: AdSupport
App Services.answer: Provide apps with access to an advertising identifier.

App Services.question: Application Services
App Services.answer: Perform common application tasks.

App Services.question: App Store Receipts
App Services.answer: Validate app and in-app purchase receipts with the App Store.

App Services.question: Automatic Assessment Configuration
App Services.answer: Prevent users from accessing specific system features during high-stakes assessment activities, such as administering an exam.

App Services.question: Background Tasks
App Services.answer: Request the system to launch your app in the background to run tasks.

App Services.question: Business Chat
App Services.answer: Chat with your customers using the Messages app.

App Services.question: Business Chat REST API
App Services.answer: Support your clients and their customers by integrating your messaging platform with the Business Chat service.

App Services.question: CallKit
App Services.answer: Display the system-calling UI for your app’s VoIP services, and coordinate your calling services with other apps and the system.

App Services.question: CareKit
App Services.answer: Create apps that help people better understand and manage their health.

App Services.question: CarPlay
App Services.answer: Integrate CarPlay in audio, communication, navigation, parking, EV-charging and food-ordering apps.

App Services.question: ClassKit
App Services.answer: Enable teachers to assign activities from your app’s content and to view student progress.

App Services.question: ClockKit
App Services.answer: Display app-specific data on the clock face.

App Services.question: CloudKit
App Services.answer: Store structured app and user data in iCloud containers that can be shared by all users of your app.

App Services.question: Combine
App Services.answer: Customize handling of asynchronous events by combining event-processing operators.

App Services.question: Contacts
App Services.answer: Access the user’s contacts and format and localize contact information.

App Services.question: Contacts UI
App Services.answer: Display information about users’ contacts in a graphical interface.

App Services.question: Core Data
App Services.answer: Persist or cache data and support undo on a single device.

App Services.question: Core Foundation
App Services.answer: Access low-level functions, primitive data types, and various collection types that are bridged seamlessly with the Foundation framework.

App Services.question: Core Location
App Services.answer: Obtain the geographic location and orientation of a device.

App Services.question: Core ML
App Services.answer: Integrate machine learning models into your app.

App Services.question: Core Motion
App Services.answer: Process accelerometer, gyroscope, pedometer, and environment-related events.

App Services.question: Core Spotlight
App Services.answer: Index your app so users can search the content from Spotlight and Safari.

App Services.question: Core Text
App Services.answer: Create text layouts, optimize font handling, and access font metrics and glyph data.

App Services.question: Create ML
App Services.answer: Create machine learning models for use in your app.

App Services.question: DeviceCheck
App Services.answer: Reduce fraudulent use of your services by managing device state and asserting app integrity.

App Services.question: EventKit
App Services.answer: Create, view, and edit calendar and reminder events.

App Services.question: EventKit UI
App Services.answer: Display an interface for viewing, selecting, and editing calendar events and reminders.

App Services.question: File Provider
App Services.answer: Implement a File Provider extension so that other apps can access the documents and directories stored and managed by your containing app.

App Services.question: File Provider UI
App Services.answer: Add actions to the document browser’s context menu.

App Services.question: HealthKit
App Services.answer: Access and share health and fitness data while maintaining the user’s privacy and control.

App Services.question: HomeKit
App Services.answer: Communicate with, configure, and control home automation accessories.

App Services.question: iAd
App Services.answer: Attribute app downloads that originate from Apple Search Ads campaigns.

App Services.question: JavaScriptCore
App Services.answer: Evaluate JavaScript programs from within an app, and support JavaScript scripting of your app.

App Services.question: MapKit
App Services.answer: Display map or satellite imagery within your app, call out points of interest, and determine placemark information for map coordinates.

App Services.question: Messages
App Services.answer: Create app extensions that allow users to send text, stickers, media files, and interactive messages.

App Services.question: Message UI
App Services.answer: Create a user interface for composing email and text messages, so users can edit and send messages without leaving your app.

App Services.question: Multipeer Connectivity
App Services.answer: Support peer-to-peer connectivity and the discovery of nearby devices.

App Services.question: Natural Language
App Services.answer: Analyze natural language text and deduce its language-specific metadata.

App Services.question: NewsstandKit
App Services.answer: Browse and download newspaper and magazine assets in the background.

App Services.question: Notification Center
App Services.answer: Create and manage widgets for the Today view.

App Services.question: PassKit (Apple Pay and Wallet)
App Services.answer: Process Apple Pay payments in your app, and create and distribute passes for the Wallet app.

App Services.question: Preference Panes
App Services.answer: Integrate your app’s custom preferences into the System Preferences app.

App Services.question: PushKit
App Services.answer: Respond to push notifications related to your app’s complications, file providers, and VoIP services.

App Services.question: QuickLook
App Services.answer: Create previews of files to use inside your app, or perform simple edits on previews.

App Services.question: Safari Services
App Services.answer: Enable web views and services in your app.

App Services.question: SiriKit
App Services.answer: Handle user requests for your app’s services that originate from Siri or Maps.

App Services.question: SMS and Call Reporting
App Services.answer: Create extensions to manage and report unwanted SMS messages and spam calls.

App Services.question: Social
App Services.answer: Post content to supported social networking services, using standard system interfaces.

App Services.question: Speech
App Services.answer: Perform speech recognition on live or prerecorded audio, receive transcriptions, alternative interpretations, and confidence levels of the results.

App Services.question: StoreKit
App Services.answer: Support in-app purchases and interactions with the App Store.

App Services.question: TV Services
App Services.answer: Provide prominent content and a description to help users discover your app.

App Services.question: User Notifications
App Services.answer: Push user-facing notifications to the user’s device from a server, or generate them locally from your app.

App Services.question: User Notifications UI
App Services.answer: Customize the interface that displays local and remote notifications.

App Services.question: Wallet Passes
App Services.answer: Create, distribute, and update passes for the Wallet app.

App Services.question: Watch Connectivity
App Services.answer: Implement two-way communication between an iOS app and its paired watchOS app.

App Services.question: WebKit
App Services.answer: Display web content in windows. Implement browser features such as following user-activated links, managing a back-forward list, and managing a history of recently visited pages.

App Services.question: WidgetKit
App Services.answer: Show relevant, glanceable content from your app on the iOS Home screen or macOS Notification Center.

Developer Tools.question: Automator
Developer Tools.answer: Develop actions that can be loaded and run by the Automator app. View, edit, and run Automator workflows in your app.

Developer Tools.question: Developer Tools Support
Developer Tools.answer: Expose custom views and modifiers in the Xcode library.

Developer Tools.question: Installer JS
Developer Tools.answer: Manage and customize the installation and distribution experience.

Developer Tools.question: Playground Bluetooth
Developer Tools.answer: Display and manage connections to Bluetooth peripherals in Swift Playgrounds.

Developer Tools.question: Playground Support
Developer Tools.answer: Share playground data, manage live views, and control the execution of a playground.

Developer Tools.question: Scripting Bridge
Developer Tools.answer: Automate scriptable apps by sending and receiving Apple events.

Developer Tools.question: StoreKit Test
Developer Tools.answer: Create and automate tests in Xcode for your app’s subscription and in-app purchase transactions.

Developer Tools.question: Swift Packages
Developer Tools.answer: Create reusable code, organize it in a lightweight way, and share it across Xcode projects and with other developers.

Developer Tools.question: Swift Playgrounds
Developer Tools.answer: Create interactive learning experiences for the Swift Playgrounds app.

Developer Tools.question: Xcode
Developer Tools.answer: Build, test, and submit your app with Apple’s integrated development environment.

Developer Tools.question: XcodeKit
Developer Tools.answer: Create extensions to add commands to the Xcode source editor.

Developer Tools.question: xcselect
Developer Tools.answer: A function that finds the path to a macOS SDK version on disk.

Developer Tools.question: XCTest
Developer Tools.answer: Create and run unit tests, performance tests, and UI tests for your Xcode project.

Graphics and Games.question: AGL
Graphics and Games.answer: Create and manage OpenGL rendering contexts for use in macOS, and perform operations on drawable objects.

Graphics and Games.question: ARKit
Graphics and Games.answer: Integrate iOS device camera and motion features to produce augmented reality experiences in your app or game.

Graphics and Games.question: ColorSync
Graphics and Games.answer: Reproduce colors accurately across a range of input, output, and display devices.

Graphics and Games.question: Core Graphics
Graphics and Games.answer: Harness the power of Quartz technology to perform lightweight 2D rendering with high-fidelity output. Handle path-based drawing, antialiased rendering, gradients, images, color management, PDF documents, and more.

Graphics and Games.question: Core Image
Graphics and Games.answer: Use built-in or custom filters to process still and video images.

Graphics and Games.question: Game Controller
Graphics and Games.answer: Support hardware game controllers in your game.

Graphics and Games.question: GameKit
Graphics and Games.answer: Create experiences that keep players coming back to your game. Add leaderboards, achievements, matchmaking, challenges, and more.

Graphics and Games.question: GameplayKit
Graphics and Games.answer: Architect and organize your game logic. Incorporate common gameplay behaviors such as random number generation, artificial intelligence, pathfinding, and agent behavior.

Graphics and Games.question: GLKit
Graphics and Games.answer: Speed up OpenGL ES or OpenGL app development. Use math libraries, background texture loading, pre-created shader effects, and a standard view and view controller to implement your rendering loop.

Graphics and Games.question: Image I/O
Graphics and Games.answer: Read and write most image file formats. Manage color and access image metadata.

Graphics and Games.question: Metal
Graphics and Games.answer: Render advanced 3D graphics and perform data-parallel computations using graphics processors.

Graphics and Games.question: MetalKit
Graphics and Games.answer: Build Metal apps quicker and easier, using far less code. Render graphics in a standard Metal view, load textures from many sources, and work efficiently with models provided by Model I/O.

Graphics and Games.question: Metal Performance Shaders
Graphics and Games.answer: Optimize graphics and compute performance with kernels that are fine-tuned for the unique characteristics of each Metal GPU family.

Graphics and Games.question: Metal Performance Shaders Graph
Graphics and Games.answer: Build, compile, and execute customized multidimensional compute graphs for linear algebra, machine learning, computer vision, and other similar domains.

Graphics and Games.question: Model I/O
Graphics and Games.answer: Import, export, and manipulate 3D models using a common infrastructure that integrates MetalKit, GLKit, and SceneKit.

Graphics and Games.question: OpenGL ES
Graphics and Games.answer: Create 3D and 2D graphics effects with this compact, efficient subset of OpenGL.

Graphics and Games.question: PDFKit
Graphics and Games.answer: Display and manipulate PDF documents in your applications.

Graphics and Games.question: PencilKit
Graphics and Games.answer: Capture touch and Apple Pencil input as a drawing, and display that content from your app.

Graphics and Games.question: Quartz
Graphics and Games.answer: Allow users to browse, edit, and save images, using slideshows and Core Image filters.

Graphics and Games.question: Core Animation
Graphics and Games.answer: Render, compose, and animate visual elements.

Graphics and Games.question: RealityKit
Graphics and Games.answer: Simulate and render 3D content for use in your augmented reality apps.

Graphics and Games.question: ReplayKit
Graphics and Games.answer: Record or stream video from the screen, and audio from the app and microphone.

Graphics and Games.question: SceneKit
Graphics and Games.answer: Create 3D games and add 3D content to apps using high-level scene descriptions. Easily add animations, physics simulation, particle effects, and realistic physically based rendering.

Graphics and Games.question: SpriteKit
Graphics and Games.answer: Add high-performance 2D content with smooth animations to your app, or create a game with a high-level set of 2D game-based tools.

Graphics and Games.question: Vision
Graphics and Games.answer: Apply computer vision algorithms to perform a variety of tasks on input images and video.

Media.question: Apple News
Media.answer: Design, create, and publish signature content for Apple News.

Media.question: Apple Search Ads
Media.answer: Drive app discovery by creating and managing campaigns with the Apple Search Ads Campaign Management API.

Media.question: Assets Library
Media.answer: Access the assets in a user’s media library.

Media.question: Audio Toolbox
Media.answer: Record or play audio, convert formats, parse audio streams, and configure your audio session.

Media.question: Audio Unit
Media.answer: Add sophisticated audio manipulation and processing capabilities to your app. Create audio unit extensions that generate or modify audio in a host app.

Media.question: AVFoundation
Media.answer: Work with audiovisual assets, control device cameras, process audio, and configure system audio interactions.

Media.question: AVKit
Media.answer: Create view-level services for media playback, complete with user controls, chapter navigation, and support for subtitles and closed captioning.

Media.question: Core MIDI
Media.answer: Communicate with MIDI devices such as hardware keyboards and synthesizers.

Media.question: Core Audio
Media.answer: Use the Core Audio framework to interact with device’s audio hardware.

Media.question: Core Audio Kit
Media.answer: Add user interfaces to audio units.

Media.question: Core Audio Types
Media.answer: Use specialized data types to interact with audio streams, complex buffers, and audiovisual timestamps.

Media.question: Core Haptics
Media.answer: Compose and play haptic patterns to customize your iOS app’s haptic feedback.

Media.question: Core Media
Media.answer: Represent time-based audio-visual assets with essential data types.

Media.question: Core Video
Media.answer: Process digital video—including manipulation of individual frames—using a pipeline-based API and support for both Metal and OpenGL.

Media.question: HTTP Live Streaming
Media.answer: Send audio and video to iOS, tvOS, and macOS devices.

Media.question: ImageCaptureCore
Media.answer: Browse for media devices and control them programmatically from your app.

Media.question: iTunes Library
Media.answer: Retrieve the properties of the media in the user’s iTunes library.

Media.question: Media Accessibility
Media.answer: Coordinate the presentation of closed-captioned data for your app’s media files.

Media.question: Media Library
Media.answer: Access read-only collections of the user’s multimedia content.

Media.question: Media Player
Media.answer: Find and play songs, audio podcasts, audio books, and more from within your app.

Media.question: Media Setup
Media.answer: Enable configuration and account management of media services for use on HomePod.

Media.question: QuickLook Thumbnailing
Media.answer: Generate thumbnails for common file types and add a Thumbnail Extension to your app to enable others to create thumbnails of your custom files.

Media.question: PhotoKit
Media.answer: Work with image and video assets managed by the Photos app, including those from iCloud Photos and Live Photos.

Media.question: Professional Video Applications
Media.answer: Exchange data with Final Cut Pro X, and create effects plug-ins for Final Cut Pro and Motion.

Media.question: Screen Saver
Media.answer: Animate screen savers, and interact with the screen saver infrastructure. Use functions that help you produce random values and centering rectangles.

Media.question: Sound Analysis
Media.answer: Analyze streamed and file-based audio to classify it as a particular type.

Media.question: Video Toolbox
Media.answer: Work directly with hardware-accelerated video encoding and decoding capabilities.

Media.question: VisionKit
Media.answer: Use the iOS camera to scan documents like those you capture in the Notes app.

Release Notes.question: iOS & iPadOS Release Notes
Release Notes.answer: Learn about changes to the iOS & iPadOS SDK.

Release Notes.question: macOS Release Notes
Release Notes.answer: Learn about changes to the macOS SDK.

Release Notes.question: Safari Release Notes
Release Notes.answer: Learn about changes for Safari for iOS and macOS, Web Inspector, WebKit view for iOS and macOS, and Safari view for iOS.

Release Notes.question: tvOS Release Notes
Release Notes.answer: Learn about changes to the tvOS SDK.

Release Notes.question: watchOS Release Notes
Release Notes.answer: Learn about changes to the watchOS SDK.

System.question: Apple Silicon
System.answer: Get the resources you need to create software for Macs with Apple silicon.

System.question: Apple Archive
System.answer: Perform multithreaded lossless compression of directories, files, and data.

System.question: InputMethodKit
System.answer: Develop input methods and manage communication with client applications, candidates windows, and input method modes.

System.question: CryptoTokenKit
System.answer: Access security tokens and the cryptographic assets they store.

System.question: Network Extension
System.answer: Customize and extend core networking features.

System.question: NetworkingDriverKit
System.answer: Develop drivers for Ethernet networking devices.

System.question: IOSurface
System.answer: Share hardware-accelerated buffer data (framebuffers and textures) across multiple processes. Manage image memory more efficiently.

System.question: Collaboration
System.answer: Find and access identities, that is, users and groups. Display the Identity Picker, which lets users create and select identities.

System.question: IOBluetooth
System.answer: Gain user-space access to Bluetooth devices.

System.question: Security Foundation
System.answer: Restrict a user’s access to particular features in your Mac app or daemon.

System.question: Exception Handling
System.answer: Monitor and debug exceptional conditions in code.

System.question: Disk Arbitration
System.answer: Provides mechanisms to register and block disk mount or unmount events.

System.question: Security Interface
System.answer: Provide user interface elements for security features such as authorization, access to digital certificates, and access to items in keychains.

System.question: SerialDriverKit
System.answer: Develop drivers for serial I/O devices connected to your Mac.

System.question: IOBluetooth UI
System.answer: Present an interface through which users can pair their devices with other Bluetooth devices.

System.question: System Configuration
System.answer: Allow applications to access a device’s network configuration settings. Determine the reachability of the device, such as whether Wi-Fi or cell connectivity are active.

System.question: Accelerate
System.answer: Make large-scale mathematical computations and image calculations, optimized for high performance and low-energy consumption.

System.question: Force Feedback
System.answer: Control force feedback devices attached to the system. Develop plug-ins that enable communication with force feedback hardware.

System.question: vmnet
System.answer: Connect with network interfaces to read and write packets on guest operating systems.

System.question: CFNetwork
System.answer: Access network services and handle changes in network configurations. Build on abstractions of network protocols to simplify tasks such as working with BSD sockets, administering HTTP and FTP servers, and managing Bonjour services.

System.question: Open Directory
System.answer: Authenticate users, and search for contact information in Open Directory and LDAP directories.

System.question: FWAUserLib
System.answer: Interface with FireWire audio devices to manage connections, audio engines, and audio and MIDI streams.

System.question: Hypervisor
System.answer: Build virtualization solutions on top of a lightweight hypervisor, without third-party kernel extensions.

System.question: Core Services
System.answer: Access and manage key operating system services, such as launch and identity services.

System.question: Service Management
System.answer: Load and unload  services, and read and modify  dictionaries from within an app.

System.question: Finder Sync
System.answer: Enhance the Finder’s user interface by adding badges, shortcut menu items, and toolbar buttons.

System.question: Latent Semantic Mapping
System.answer: The Latent Semantic Mapping framework supports the classification of text and other token-based content into developer-defined categories.

System.question: Local Authentication
System.answer: Authenticate users biometrically or with a passphrase they already know.

System.question: IOKit
System.answer: Access hardware devices and drivers from your apps and services.

System.question: Core Bluetooth
System.answer: Communicate with Bluetooth low energy and BR/EDR (“Classic”) Devices.

System.question: Security
System.answer: Secure the data your app manages, and control access to your app.

System.question: Core Telephony
System.answer: Access information about a user’s cellular service provider, such as its unique identifier and whether the carrier allows VoIP.

System.question: Objective-C Runtime
System.answer: Gain low-level access to the Objective-C runtime and the Objective-C root types.

System.question: simd
System.answer: Perform computations on small vectors and matrices.

System.question: Compression
System.answer: Leverage common compression algorithms for lossless data compression.

System.question: Dispatch
System.answer: Execute code concurrently on multicore hardware by submitting work to dispatch queues managed by the system.

System.question: XPC
System.answer: Access a low-level (libSystem) interprocess communication mechanism that is based on serialized property lists.

System.question: Core WLAN
System.answer: Query AirPort interfaces and choose wireless networks.

System.question: os
System.answer: Log application behaviors for future analysis.

System.question: GSS
System.answer: Conduct secure, authenticated network transactions.

System.question: External Accessory
System.answer: Communicate with accessories connected to a device by the Apple Lightning connector, or connected wirelessly through Bluetooth.

System.question: dnssd
System.answer: Discover, publish, and resolve network services on a local area or wide area network.

System.question: Core NFC
System.answer: Detect NFC tags, read messages that contain NDEF data, and save data to writable tags.

System.question: Authentication Services
System.answer: Make it easy for users to log into apps and services.

System.question: Network
System.answer: Create network connections to send and receive data using transport and security protocols.

System.question: Device Management
System.answer: Manage your organization’s devices remotely.

System.question: MetricKit
System.answer: Aggregate and analyze per-device reports on exception and crash diagnostics, and on power and performance metrics.

System.question: DriverKit
System.answer: Develop device drivers that run in user space.

System.question: Endpoint Security
System.answer: Develop system extensions that enhance user security.

System.question: Execution Policy
System.answer: Provide functionality so developer tools can manage execution policy exceptions.

System.question: System Extensions
System.answer: Install and manage user space code that extends the capabilities of macOS.

System.question: USBDriverKit
System.answer: Develop drivers for USB-based devices.

System.question: HIDDriverKit
System.answer: Develop drivers for human-interface devices, such as keyboards, pointing devices, and digitizers like pens and touch pads.

System.question: IOUSBHost
System.answer: Create host-mode user space drivers for USB devices.

System.question: Kernel
System.answer: Develop kernel-resident device drivers and kernel extensions.

System.question: Apple CryptoKit
System.answer: Perform cryptographic operations securely and efficiently.

System.question: OSLog
System.answer: A unified logging system for the reading of historical data.

System.question: App Tracking Transparency
System.answer: Request user authorization to access app-related data for tracking the user or the device.

System.question: Exposure Notification
System.answer: Implement a COVID-19 exposure notification system that protects user privacy.

System.question: ML Compute
System.answer: Accelerate training and validation of neural networks across the CPU and one or more GPUs.

System.question: Nearby Interaction
System.answer: Locate and interact with nearby devices using distance, direction, and identifier.

System.question: Paravirtualized Graphics
System.answer: Add graphics acceleration to your guest driver stack.

System.question: SCSIControllerDriverKit
System.answer: Develop drivers for SCSI protocol-based devices.

System.question: SensorKit
System.answer: Retrieve data and derived metrics from an iPhone’s sensors, or from a paired Apple Watch.

System.question: Darwin Notify
System.answer: Send and receive Darwin notifications.

System.question: USBSerialDriverKit
System.answer: Develop drivers for serial USB devices connected to your Mac.

System.question: App Store Server Notifications
System.answer: Monitor in-app purchase events in real time with server notifications from the App Store.

System.question: PCIDriverKit
System.answer: Develop device drivers for Peripheral Component Interconnect (PCI) accessories.

System.question: System
System.answer: Perform low-level file operations using type-safe APIs.

System.question: Uniform Type Identifiers
System.answer: Unified type information for files and data transfer.

System.question: Kernel Management
System.answer: Manage the loading and unloading of system extensions in the kernel.

System.question: Virtualization
System.answer: Create virtual machines and run Linux-based operating systems.

Web.question: Apple Music API
Web.answer: Integrate streaming music with Apple Music content.

Web.question: Apple Pay on the Web
Web.answer: Support Apple Pay on your website with JavaScript-based APIs.

Web.question: App Store Connect API
Web.answer: Automate the tasks you perform on the Apple Developer website and in App Store Connect.

Web.question: CloudKit JS
Web.answer: Provide access from your web app to your CloudKit app’s containers and databases.

Web.question: Link Presentation
Web.answer: Fetch, provide, and present rich links in your app.

Web.question: LivePhotosKit JS
Web.answer: Play Live Photos on the web.

Web.question: MapKit JS
Web.answer: Embed interactive Apple maps on your website, annotate points of interest, and perform geo-related searches.

Web.question: MusicKit JS
Web.answer: Add an Apple Music player to your web app.

Web.question: Safari Extensions JS
Web.answer: Extend the browsing experience with injected scripts and style sheets for web content, custom buttons in the Safari toolbar, and contextual menu items.

Web.question: Screen Time
Web.answer: Share and manage web-usage data, and observe changes made by a parent or guardian.

Web.question: Sign in with Apple
Web.answer: Provide users the ability to sign in to your apps and websites using their Apple ID.

Web.question: Siri Event Suggestions Markup
Web.answer: Embed reservation data in email and webpages that updates users’ calendars and informs suggestions from Siri.

Web.question: Maps Web Snapshots
Web.answer: Create a static image of a map from a URL.

Web.question: WebKit JS
Web.answer: Access and modify DOM elements within a webpage, including touch events and visual effects.
